page.title: 08LIVING IN GROBY.
page.content: In Groby life is like any other village near a town.It has quite a lot of fairs and fetes,especially on Saturdays and Sundays in the summer. There are flourishing organisations like the Guides,Scouts,Cubs and Brownies.These meet either in the Scout Headquarters or in one of the Primary Schools. Most people go out of Groby to work although some work at the local Industrial Estate. On weekdays there is a 'rush hour' on Ratby Road between 8am and 9am,also between 5pm and 6pm. Life in Groby is great because it isn't too busy either.The only criticisms are that the village could be better policed and the quality of the road surfaces could be improved.
